title: Incorrect Code Modification Target During VAR-005 Execution

comment: REVIEW FINDING - NON-COMPLIANT: Section 9 (Execution Summary) contains placeholder text '[EXECUTION_SUMMARY]'. Placeholder content is not permitted. For a document at PRE_REVIEW stage, Section 9 should contain appropriate pre-execution text such as 'To be completed during execution' rather than a bracketed placeholder. All other sections verified complete. Frontmatter verified: title='Incorrect Code Modification Target During VAR-005 Execution', revision_summary='Initial draft - complete investigation content'. Structure follows SOP-003 Section 5 requirements. Root cause analysis is sound. CAPAs are appropriate. Remove or replace the placeholder before re-routing for review.

REVIEW COMPLETE - COMPLIANT. Verified: (1) Frontmatter - title='Incorrect Code Modification Target During VAR-005 Execution', revision_summary describes updates to root cause analysis and CAPA-003; (2) All 10 sections per SOP-003 Section 5 present and complete; (3) Section 4 now includes detailed file list (11 files) and specific evidence; (4) Root cause analysis (Section 6) correctly identifies lack of technical controls as primary cause, articulates principle that qms-cli changes should only enter via git operations after qualification; (5) CAPAs appropriate - two corrective (verify clean, re-execute VAR-005) and one preventive (explore edit blocking); (6) Section 8 documents emergency rollback with exact git commands and verification; (7) No {{draft}} placeholders remain; (8) Square-bracket placeholders in Sections 7-10 appropriate for execution phase; (9) No typos or formatting issues. Recommend approval.

REVIEW COMPLETE - COMPLIANT. Verified: (1) Frontmatter present - title='Incorrect Code Modification Target During VAR-005 Execution', revision_summary describes updates; (2) Sections 1-6 (pre-approval content) complete per SOP-003 Section 5; (3) Section 4 includes detailed evidence (11 files listed, git status output, import error); (4) Root cause analysis correctly identifies lack of technical controls, articulates principle that qms-cli changes should only enter via git operations after qualification; (5) Three CAPAs defined - CAPA-001/002 corrective, CAPA-003 preventive addressing root cause; (6) Sections 7-10 appropriately contain square-bracket execution placeholders per template convention; (7) No draft placeholders remain; (8) References complete; (9) No typos or formatting issues. Recommend approval.
